instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2523: What is 820-2523? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.SMC_ONOF_L: What is SMC_ONOF_L? This is a typo of SMC_ONOFF_L When you see SMC_ONOF_L, assume they meant to type SMC_ONOFF_L.
definitions.C6990: What is C6990? Capacitor to ground on input to PP3V42_G3H power supply. PP3V42_G3H power supply turns 18.5v from charger or 8.5v-12.5v PPBUS_G3H from the battery into PP3V42_G3H. This capacitor can short to ground and keep PP3V42_G3H from turning on which would keep the machine from having a light on the magsafe charger.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2523</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot
threads.message:
Hi,
this motherboard is clean, no liquid, the customer say after change his battery the macbook won't start.
I check
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>=12,5
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_CPU_IMVP_ISNS</SIGNAL>=12,5V
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>=16,8V
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>=0
When i short pin 5 J5713 the mac don't start
<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL>=0V
<SIGNAL>SMC_ONOF_L</SIGNAL>=3V3
nothing burn on the board. where can i check?
thanks

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2523</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot
threads.message:
Diode mode on L6995?
Voltage on <CAPACITOR>C6990</CAPACITOR>?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2523</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot
threads.message:
L6995 1=0,315     2=0,315, with power adapter L6995 = 3,41V in voltage mode.
<CAPACITOR>C6990</CAPACITOR>=15,92V

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2523</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot
threads.message: So, why you say <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> = 0V?? Please check and confirm <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL>=0V..... Voltage on L7260?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2523</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot
threads.message:
i make a mistake
<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL>=3,379V
L7260=0V each side, in diode mode 0V, in ohm 0,5, i think it's short. i try to find.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2523</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot
threads.message: <CAPACITOR>C2560</CAPACITOR> is short, i remove it now work well, thanks aprendiz.
